description: From Ancient Greek ζυμωτικός (zumōtikós, “causing fermentation”), from ζυμοῦν (zumoûn).

entries.meaning: (pathology, now historical) Infectious, contagious, of diseases originally regarded as being caused by a process similar to fermentation.
examples: […]  these  […]  accounts by no means bear out the zymotic doctrine of the Board of Health as to the cause of cholera; for where the zymotic influences from the sewers were the worst,  […]  the cholera was the least destructive.
